title: Question 8
prompt: A box of candy contains 24 light chocolates and 12 dark chocolates. If you choose a piece of candy without looking, what are your odds of choosing a dark chocolate?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
This question asks for the probability of choosing a dark chocolate at random out of a box. The probability is the ratio of dark chocolates to all chocolates in the box. By adding together the light chocolates and the dark chocolates, you can find the total number of chocolates in the box: 36.

24 light chocolates +12 dark chocolates =36 chocolates

The number of dark chocolates is 12, giving a ratio of 12 in 36, or 1 in 3.
